page.title: 20Handicapped at Westmeston
page.content: This Georgian house formerly a private residence, is run as a joint residential and day care centre for mentally handicapped people. Its correct title is the Westmeston Rural Training Centre but everyone locally knows it as Middleton Manor. The aim is not necessarily to train horticult_ urists but to help mentally handicapped people look forward to the future with self confidence,with desirable work skills and with a realistic view of themselves. They are entitled to the same respect and position in society as so called normal people, and every effort is made to explode the stigma attached to mental handicap and to help the local community to accept the students with_ out prejudice. The staff champion the right to life, to love, to work and to leisure.
